abstract.p: Correction of May 28 Home section article on renovation of Algonquin Hotel

block.p: An article on Thursday about a renovation at the Algonquin Hotel misstated the relation of Roger Angell, the New Yorker writer, to the author E. B. White. He is White's stepson, not his son. The article also misspelled the given name of Mr. Angell's mother, an Algonquin habitue who was The New Yorker's fiction editor, and misstated the surname she used professionally. After her marriage to White in 1929, she was known as Katharine S. White, not Katherine Sergeant Angell.
